description: From Late Latin hyperboreanus, cognate with Classical Latin hyperboreus, from Ancient Greek ὑπερβόρεος (huperbóreos), composed of ὑπέρ (hupér, “over”) + βόρειος (bóreios, “northern”). See also Ὑπερβόρεοι (Huperbóreoi).

adjectives.description: hyperborean (comparative more hyperborean, superlative most hyperborean)

entries.meaning: Pertaining to the extreme north of the earth, or (usually jocular) to a specific northern country or area.
(Greek mythology, usually capitalised) One of a race of people living in the extreme north, beyond the north wind.
examples: The Hyperboreans venerated Apollo over the other gods.

entries.meaning: (usually humorous) Any person living in a northern country, or to the north.
